snippet: At an annual convention, gun owners reaffirmed their reasons to carry a concealed weapon and expressed concern about the future of Stand Your Ground laws.
abstract: Gun enthusiasts gathering at the National Rifle Association's annual convention are reluctant to pass judgement on the Florida shooting case, in which George Zimmerman has been charged with second-degree murder in the death of teenager Trayvon Martin; many express anxiety that the case could hamper the NRA's mission to pass and uphold Stand Your Ground laws and other protections for those who carry concealed weapons.
lead_paragraph: At an annual convention, gun owners reaffirmed their reasons to carry a concealed weapon and expressed concern about the future of Stand Your Ground laws.

headline.seo: Trayvon Martin Case Felt at N.R.A. Convention
headline.main: After Florida Shooting, N.R.A. Crowd Sticks to What It Knows
headline.print_headline: After Florida Shooting, N.R.A. Crowd Sticks to What It Knows
